title: Install Vertica
content:
To install and set up a new Vertica database perform the following:

  1. Compute resources and storage using the Sizing calculator.
  2. Sync the time between Kubernetes and Vertica.
  3. Check the supported Vertica versions and operating systems. 
  4. Download the Vertica package from the Software Licenses and Downloads website.
  5. See the following Vertica documentation sections before you install Vertica:
    Vertica documentation link Description
    Installing Vertica   Contains information to install Vertica based on your platform.
    Recommendations for Sizing Vertica Nodes and Cluster

    Contains recommendations for hardware for your Vertica nodes. It also provides information that helps you appropriately size the hardware components to meet the needs of your environment. Vertica recommends that the disk utilization per node mustn't be more than 60%.
    Supported Operating Systems and File System Requirements for Vertica Server Contains information about the operating systems and file systems required for the installation of the Vertica server.
    Vertica in a Virtualized Environment

    Contains information about installing Vertica in a virtualized environment.
    Required packages

    Contains information about the packages that require installation on all nodes in your cluster before you install the database platform.
    Installation Overview and Checklist

    Contains an overview of installation tasks.
    Before You Install Vertica Provides the required steps to ensure the node on which you install Vertica meets all the prerequisites.

    You can check the swappiness value by running the following command:

    $ cat /proc/sys/vm/swappiness
    Configuring the Network to Import and Export Data This knowledge base article provides information on configuring the network to import and export data. This configuration is optional. If you have installed the Vertica cluster in an isolated network for data synchronization, you must also configure the network interface to avoid problems with the communication between Operations Platform and the Vertica cluster. For more information on this configuration, see the Configuring the Network to Import and Export Data.
  6. Log in as the root user on one of the nodes of the Vertica cluster. Run the following command:
    rpm -ivh vertica-<version>.x86_64.RHEL6.rpm
  7. Run the validation scripts as mentioned in the Vertica documentation.
  8. Run the following install_vertica command as the root user. In a Vertica cluster, run the command on one of your nodes only and it installs and configures Vertica on all your intended cluster nodes. 
    /opt/vertica/sbin/install_vertica --hosts <FQDN_of_Node1,FQDN_of_Node2,FQDN_of_Node3> --rpm /var/tmp/vertica-<version>.x86_64.RHEL6.rpm [ --dba-user <db-admin-username> ] [ --data-dir <database data files path> ] [ --point-to-point ]

    Where:
    <FQDN_of_Node1,FQDN_of_Node2,FQDN_of_Node3> is a comma separated list of FQDNs of the servers on which you are installing Vertica.  For a single node Vertica, give the Vertica node hostname or IP address.

    <db-admin-username> is the name of the database superuser system account to create, if it doesn't exist.  If you don't specify the --dba-user parameter, the default account name is dbadmin.

    <database data files path> is the data directory where the database data and catalog files are stored. It can be overridden in the create a Vertica database step if you wish to specify separate directories for the data and catalog directories. If you don't specify the --data-dir parameter, the default location is /home/dbadmin. Please follow your company's best practices when deciding whether you should change the default behavior. If your data files path is different from /home/dbadmin, ensure that you change the ownership to <db-admin-username>, or the installation fails.

    For example, the highest throughput is usually obtained when placing the catalog and data files on different filesystems that are mounted on different underlying storage devices.
    Specify the --point-to-point parameter if the Vertica nodes in your cluster are running on virtual servers or aren't on the same subnet. Also, use this option for all virtual environment installations, whether the virtual servers are on the same subnet or not.
    For more information on the install_vertica script, see Installing Vertica with the Installation Script and install_vertica Options. If you see any errors while you run the install_vertica script, follow the Vertica documentation links that appear on the command prompt to resolve them.

    Example:

    /opt/vertica/sbin/install_vertica --hosts VerticaNode1.example.net,VerticaNode2.example.net,VerticaNode3.example.net --rpm /var/tmp/vertica-<version>.x86_64.RHEL6.rpm --dba-user dbadmin --data-dir /var/opt/vertica --point-to-point
  9. On the Vertica host, as the <db-admin-username>, run the /opt/vertica/bin/adminTools program. The program prompts you to enter a license file. Enter the path to the license key. Select Accept for the End User License Agreement and exit the program. For more information to apply the license, see Vertica documentation.
  10. As the <db-admin-username>, run the following command to create a Vertica database: 
    /opt/vertica/bin/adminTools -t create_db -d <db-name> -p <db-password> --hosts=<FQDN_of_Node1>,<FQDN_of_Node2>,<FQDN_of_Node3> [ --data_path=<path of data directory> --catalog_path=<path of catalog directory> ]

    Where: 
    db-name: Vertica database instance name.

    db-password: is the password for the Vertica database instance. The password can't be the same as the username (dbadmin by default).

    Replace <FQDN_of_Node1>,<FQDN_of_Node2>,<FQDN_of_Node3> with the host names of Vertica cluster.
    <path of data directory> Replace with the path of the database data files. If you don't specify the --data_path parameter, the --data-dir uses the command configured in the install_vertica.
    <path of catalog directory> Replace with the path of the catalog files. It's your decision on whether to specify non-default paths to obtain higher performance. Vertica product documentation discusses best practices for preparing disk storage locations.

    Example:

    /opt/vertica/bin/adminTools -t create_db -d itomdb -p 'MyPassword' --hosts=VerticaNode1.example.net,VerticaNode2.example.net,VerticaNode3.example.net --data_path=/var/opt/vertica --catalog_path=/var/opt/vertica

    This example uses 'MyPassword' as the password for the itomdb database instance. For more information to create the Vertica database, see Vertica documentation.
